page.title: 10Community Centre & Primary S
page.content: CASTLE DOUGLAS COMMUNITY CENTRE opened in 1982 funded by the Regional Council and management committee. The building is open most of the day. The classes include painting, languages, local history, computers and different organisations use the building. Most popular with children is the playscheme and with adults the local history. The latest club is the Heartstroke Patients Club. The building can be booked for sales etc. CASTLE DOUGLAS PRIMARY SCHOOL opened in 1934 with Mr Hogg as Headmaster. Today there are 320 pupils and Mrs Ritchie is Headmistress, Mr Hogg retired in August 1977. Every year there is a sports day held, usually in June. The school is split up into four teams. They are Deer, Eagle, Hare and Swift.
